column3: Notion’s Creative Team is a group of strategists, designers, illustrators, filmmakers, writers, technologists, and producers that deliver on all of Notion’s brand and creative expressions. We’re looking for a talented Creative Lead for our website to guide design and planning for our most important touchpoint, &lt

As Web Design Lead, you will be responsible for collaboratively shaping the vision for our web design system and key projects, launches, and other special initiatives that contribute to driving excellence in craft and performance for our marketing site. This role reports to the Head of Creative and will:&lt

column7: Develop and maintain Notion’s web presence, ensuring consistency in design, usability, and performance across all web properties.&lt
Partner with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, Product, and Design, to define and execute a cohesive web strategy that aligns with Notion’s brand and business goals.&lt

column5: Innovate through web design and technology.&lt
column7: Utilize the latest web technologies and design trends to create engaging and interactive web experiences that captivate and convert users.&lt
Manage web projects from initial concept through to final execution, coordinating with stakeholders, setting timelines, and ensuring deliverables are met on schedule.&lt
Educate and mentor team members on web design best practices, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation within the web creative team.&lt
You’ll mentor and motivate a talented team of interaction designers, while designing often, too.&lt
in creative work focused on UX / web projects either in-house or agency-side
column8: 2+ years managing a team of 3+. Work in SaaS, or experience across both B2B and B2C audiences a plus.&lt

column5: Highest bar for quality of design:&lt
column7: You’re still active in your craft and comfortable pitching in wherever needed to help your team. You’re a strong collaborator to Eng / PM leads, and with experience working with these functions as well as TPgM. You consider a11y and usability best practices in motivating your decisions.&lt

column5: Exceptional eye for detail at every stage:&lt
column7: You sweat the small stuff, from mobile breakpoints to janky motion. And you consider details in a broader sense as well, emphasizing evidence-led design decision-making, user behavior understanding, coherent journey formation across our website, and an intuitive and seasoned grasp for what will resonate in the market.&lt

You delight in building scalable, repeatable systems for a rapidly growing business, and in finding ways to modernize and bring delight to users and prospective customers across B2B and B2C and a range of audiences and profiles.&lt

You motivate your team with mentorship, commitment, and optimism. You define goals and track progress with TPgM Lead and ops partners. You are unfazed by ambiguous problem areas and thrive at running ambitious plans through to completion — even as requirements and priorities shift.&lt

You have both empathy and passion for being an essential part of the creative process and view the quality of the team’s work as a direct reflection of your own. You’ve led major web work before, and can exemplify best practices and model customer-centricity in your efforts.&lt

You are able to articulate a vision, strategy, or idea clearly, keep your team organized, and forge strong partnerships across diverse sets of stakeholders. You’re comfortable leading cross-team and/or multi-phase projects from ideation through implementation E2E. Your documentation and planning decisions help make ambiguity more tractable to unblock your team.&amp

column3: Experience using Notion - bonus points for both personal and work use!&lt
Most of the team can code front-end, so coding knowledge (CSS, HTML, JS, React (Next.js), TypeScript) a plus.&lt

We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our global employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making software toolmaking ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.&lt

Notion is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Notion considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Notion is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know.&lt

Notion is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco, the estimated base salary range for this role is $200,000 - $260,000&lt

column7:
Privy,Seed,Staff Fullstack Software Engineer,Engineering,New York,

As a Fullstack Software Engineer at Privy, you will take on large areas of ownership in Privy’s product, architecture, and infrastructure. Because we build a developer tool, engineering and product are inextricably connected. We value intuitive interfaces, simplicity, and rapid iteration. Above all, we are building a company together to ship products that users love.

What you'll do

  • Design intuitive interfaces to break down complex systems and turn them into delightful developer tooling

  • Build and integrate systems end-to-end across client-side and server-side APIs to enable a seamless developer experience

  • Design and implement end-to-end product features driven by user needs

  • Advocate for usability and interface coherence across our teams and products

  • Enforce web development best practices across our entire product collaborating with other core stakeholders

What we're looking for

  • Deep knowledge of React, Typescript, Next.js

  • Experience building and maintaining a production system at scale

  • Prior experience working closely with a designer to iterate on a product

  • An understanding of modern web development best practices

  • Experience writing delightful developer documentation

  • 5+ years of experience

Bonus points if you have...

  • Written open-source developer tooling

  • Published about your work (code, presentations, papers, blog posts, etc.)

  • Past experience working in authentication, security, or in web3

Engineering at Privy

Engineering at Privy is not just about writing world-class code. We create software that turns complex technical systems into delightful developer tools. We assemble tried-and-true primitives into intuitive, responsive APIs and beautiful interfaces. We believe in open-source work and transparency with our teammates and users. We encourage each other to think big, run experiments and follow our curiosity so we can build better tooling that lets developers shine and empowers their users.

Privy is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of background, identity, or status.

"

UpCodes,Series A,Sr. Software Engineer,Engineering,Remote,"

THE ROLE

As a foundational member of our engineering team, you'll be involved in end-to-end development on features across our web product.

We have a frequent cadence of shipping new features and a close connection to our market.  With 700k monthly active users spending hundreds of thousands of hours on the platform, each contribution and feature you ship will have a meaningful impact for the users.

Since we're a startup, you'll have to be willing to get your hands dirty with (and learn) everything across the stack: API design, devops, frontend, data engineering, algorithms, AI, startup engineering, analytics, etc.  You'll also mentor junior software engineers.

 

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

  • 5+ years of experience building web apps

  • Clean simple code, even when solving complex problems

  • Good systems design and architecture knowledge

  • Good knowledge of the software life cycle, including code reviews, testing, team organization

  • Ability to balance business concerns with engineering considerations

  • Ability to learn new tech quickly

  • Experience mentoring junior engineers

  • Experience interacting with multiple stakeholders

  • Enjoyable to work with

TECHNOLOGY STACK

  • Python, PostgreSQL, FastAPI, Redis, TypeScript, React, Next.js, Tailwind, AWS, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Pinecone, GPT-4

 EXAMPLE PROJECTS

  • Craft plan to measure and improve our search engine

  • Improve and migrate our data model for the content we host

  • Migrate our NLP algorithms over to use LLMs

  • Do thorough, prompt code reviews

  • Implement developer tools to help with code quality

Job Type: Full-Time

Location: 100% remote

US-based comp range*: $140k-$185k

Latin America-based comp range*: $105k-$140k (USD)

Canada-based comp range*: $125k-$165k (USD)


* Plus equity (cost of living agnostic)

column11: is a leader in software development with a focus on delivering high-quality web solutions for clients across various sectors. Our projects involve a mix of content management systems, including Drupal, WordPress, and custom Python and Next.js applications. We are currently seeking an experienced SRE contractor whose first set of tasks is improving our CI/CD process. Additional work includes improving observability using Prometheus, Grafana, and helping with site migrations onto our Kubernetes platform.&amp

column5: CI/CD Contractor at Fruition, your first tasks will be converting gitlab CI/CDs which include various tests into Buddy.works. You will play a crucial role in optimizing our CI/CD pipelines for various content management systems and web applications.&lt

column3: You will also be responsible for migrating our existing CI/CD workflows from GitLab to Buddy Works, along with configuring Prometheus for monitoring and reporting.&lt

Collaborate with our development teams to migrate our existing CI/CD pipelines from gitlab to buddy.works. While making the builds as efficient for Drupal, WordPress, Python, and Next.js applications as possible.&lt
Implement and or improve best practices for automated testing, code quality checks, and deployment strategies.&lt
Lead the migration of our CI/CD processes from GitLab CI/CD to Buddy Works, ensuring a seamless transition.&lt
Configure and maintain CI/CD pipelines in Buddy Works for different project types.&lt
Work with our infrastructure team to integrate CI/CD pipelines with Kubernetes and Rancher for containerized deployments.&lt
Ensure that deployment workflows are scalable and reliable.&lt
Provide support for CI/CD processes related to Drupal, WordPress, Python, and Next.js sites.&lt
Troubleshoot deployment issues and optimize deployment configurations.&lt
Continue to refine our Prometheus/Grafana for monitoring and reporting on the health and performance of our applications.&lt
Define and configure alerting rules to proactively address issues.&lt
Script out mass site migrations from generic hosting provides to Fruition&#39
Experience in implementing CI/CD pipelines for Drupal, WordPress, Python, and Next.js applications.&lt
Familiarity with GitLab, GitHub, Buddy Works, Kubernetes, and Rancher.&lt
Strong scripting and automation skills (e.g., shell scripting, Python, or other scripting languages).&lt
Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher).&lt
Knowledge of Prometheus or similar monitoring tools.&lt
Self-motivated and able to work independently.&lt
This is an hourly contract position.&lt

Lattice,,Software Engineer, Talent Suite",Engineering,"SF, NYC, Remote","&lt

Lattice’s Engineering team is continuously working to better both our product and our craft. We use a modern, cutting-edge tech stack aimed at developer productivity and delight. We strive for maintainable, robust, and performant code. We’re highly collaborative and continuously iterative and work closely with designers and product managers. We prioritize not only great technical architecture but also an amazing product experience.&lt

You will play an important role in working on our Grow, Goals, and Manager Tools (feedback, 1:1s, updates) products which empower managers to cultivate continuous, meaningful interactions with their direct reports to drive impactful outcomes. In this role, you will also:&lt

You’ll work with other engineers to build and own products across a modern tech stack. Our current stack includes React, Relay Modern, TypeScript, GraphQL, Node, and PostgreSQL. We rely on AWS to host our infrastructure.&lt
You’ll assist in debugging and troubleshooting issues in existing applications, ensuring functionality and performance are optimized.&lt
You’ll participate in code reviews and testing processes to ensure high-quality software deliverables and improve your coding skills.&lt
You’ll contribute to project documentation and maintain technical documentation for reference and reporting purposes.&lt
You’ll make contributions to our engineering practices, identifying and evangelizing improvements to improve our team output.&lt
What You Will Bring to the Table&lt
You have 2+ years of professional experience writing and maintaining production-level applications.&lt
You have production-level experience writing full stack JavaScript / Typescript, and are well versed in frameworks such as React, Relay, Next.js and GraphQL.&lt
You are no stranger to SQL — you know how to efficiently model data and write performant queries in a relational database like PostgreSQL.&lt
You seek out the root cause when debugging software defects, and champion improvements that prevent future issues.&lt
You are passionate about clean code, DRY patterns, and high-performance code.&lt
You are clear and concise in explaining your thought process and in enumerating the tradeoffs made in your work.&lt
You have strong communication skills, both verbal and written.&amp
You can work well with designers and product managers to come up with optimal solutions.&lt

column74:
Summer Health,Series A,Staff Engineer, AI",Engineering,New York Office,"

Who we are

Summer Health is helping raise the healthiest generation with 24/7 text-based access to pediatric care. We believe that every family deserves quick, reliable, trusted access to health care when and where they need it most, and our aim is to improve the health outcomes of millions of children.

We have raised over $19M through Series A funding from investors including Sequoia, Lux, 7wire Ventures, Chelsea Clinton’s Metrodora Capital, Pivotal Ventures, Box Group, and others to achieve this goal.

AI-powered technology is at the heart of our approach enabling us to scale our impact and bring our vision to life. AI is not just a part of our technology stack
column75:
it is woven into every facet of our operations, driving everything from internal processes to customer-facing solutions. Our team has developed a best-in-class healthcare experience that delivers quality care without compromising simplicity and security. We're now looking to expand our AI capabilities to enhance scalability and accessibility, ensuring healthcare remains frictionless.

We’re looking for exceptional engineers who share our passion for transforming pediatrics. We are outliers with a bias to action to raise the standard of care and what’s achievable. If you're a T-shaped engineer with hands-on AI expertise and a commitment to making a difference, we want you on our cross-functional team. Join us in our pursuit to make healthcare better and more accessible for children everywhere.

As a Staff AI Engineer you will

  • Be a thought leader in AI technologies and trends to empower all team members.

  • Collaborate with product and clinical team members to understand the problems our providers and patients face.

  • Develop and lead our LLM platform offering to enhance all areas of our clinical offering.

  • Work with a small team of engineers to architect, build and maintain Summer Health.

  • Model and uphold high standards for an inclusive and diverse engineering team.


You may be a fit for this role if you

  • Have 6+ years of experience in software development.

  • Demonstrate experience and depth in building products through applying LLMs or other AI domains like NLP, ML or deep learning.

  • Can contribute full-stack, seeing LLM implementations from concept to production.

  • Are opinionated on approaches and solutions but humble to adapt and learn the right tools for the problem and team.

  • Have experience with HIPAA compliance or a willingness to learn.

  • Thrive in a collaborative yet distributed working environment. Our team is distributed throughout the US with most in NYC and SF.

  • Care deeply about providing the best care to the thousands of families using our platform to build the healthiest generation.

How we work

Summer Health is an AI-first and tech-forward healthcare company. We’re challenging the status quo with our approach to solutions and technology. We build faster healthcare solutions in a Typescript mono-repo with tools and frameworks like NestJS, Next.js, Temporal and Medplum.

You can find out more on how we approach problems in our dev blog: https://summer-health.github.io/ or in the case studies and publications featuring our team’s work:

  • OpenAI customer story: https://openai.com/customer-stories/summer-health

  • Medplum case study: https://www.medplum.com/blog/summer-case-study

  • Ops I Did it Again podcast: https://www.outofpocket.health/podcasts/real-gen-ai-use-cases-in-healthcare-matthew-woo-co-founder-summer-health

We’ve got you covered

  • Competitive base salary. Compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors like experience and expertise.

  • Equity compensation. All of our offers include meaningful stock options.

  • Non-accrual PTO. Take time off whenever you need it.

  • Medical insurance. We cover 75% of your premium and 50% of your dependents’ premiums.

  • Dental and vision insurance. We cover 100% of the premium for you and dependents.

  • One Medical membership. One Medical is a members-only medical concierge platform accessible to all of our employees free of charge.

  • Retirement 401(k). Save for retirement through our plan through Slavic.

  • Workstation setup. We offer a one-time $250 stipend to make sure you can create a work environment that supports your unique needs.

  • Monthly book club lunches. Reimburse monthly audible + lunch of your choice each month and enjoy it over Zoom with your lovely colleagues while discussing the book of the month.

  • Parental leave. Twelve weeks of paid leave after 1 year at the company.

column11: is saving and improving lives by making medical software safe and reliable. We empower software teams building medical applications to create safe, secure, and compliant products used by patients and providers worldwide. We believe that, by automating much of the documentation and quality processes, teams will be able to produce safer and more innovative medical software faster.&lt

column3: Ketryx is at the forefront of helping teams incorporate AI/ML into medical software and that’s why we need you!&lt

Join us in an exciting opportunity as a Senior Developer, where you will become an integral part of an extraordinary team of engineers dedicated to shaping the future of software at Ketryx. In this dynamic role, you will contribute to a small, highly motivated team, actively steering projects to successful completion. Your expertise will span both the frontend and backend of Ketryx&#39
column4: s innovative technology as you collaborate seamlessly with fellow developers to implement cutting-edge features.&lt

column3: As a Senior Developer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technological landscape, assuming ownership of critical technology decisions and roadmaps. With a self-starting attitude and a robust hands-on mentality, you will be at the forefront of tackling complex problems, inspiring your team, and driving innovation. Embracing agile working models, you will foster ideation, envision future possibilities, and address detailed improvements concurrently, contributing to Ketryx&#39
column4: s commitment to reinventing how medical device manufacturers bring life-saving innovations to market.&lt

column3: The ideal candidate is someone who possesses a deep passion for software and a profound desire to contribute to enhancing patient treatments through technological innovation. Your innate inquisitiveness, coupled with an unwavering enthusiasm for challenging assumptions, sets you apart. With excellent communication skills in both spoken and written English, you thrive in collaborative environments, where the exchange of ideas is paramount.&lt

As a self-starter, you relish the opportunity to excel in a fast-paced startup environment, taking ownership of technology decisions and roadmaps. Your commitment to driving innovation aligns seamlessly with the ethos of our team, making you an invaluable asset in shaping the future of software at Ketryx. You are driven by a genuine love for software, a desire to improve patient outcomes, and the excitement of navigating cutting-edge challenges.&lt

You’re an EU citizen or have a working visa for Austria (unfortunately, we aren’t currently able to support non-EU citizens for this position). We are looking for someone located in or willing to relocate to Vienna. Remote in the EU will be considered for the right candidate.&lt
5+ years of industry experience (or equivalent) with fullstack development&lt
Prior experience with designing database schemas and performing efficient database queries&lt
Prior experience with Next.js and GraphQL&lt
Prior experience with AWS or other cloud technologies&lt
Prior experience with AI, particularly large language models&lt
Prior experience in a regulated industry&lt

For Austrian employees, we are offering an attractive compensation package well above the IT collectively agreed monthly minimum basic salary (IT-KV, with classification ST2/standard €4,346). The anticipated gross annual salary starts at €80,000 plus performance-based bonus and will be adjusted according to your qualifications and experience.&amp
Competitive salary and generous stock options&lt
Work in an exciting field with a positive impact on the world&lt
Opportunity to learn and grow as part of a global team&lt
Hybrid work model (mix of work from home and office is possible)&lt

Ketryx is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.&lt
